alert.note: Alert for Martin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 8:31PM EDT until September 03 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Kentucky, including the following county, Martin. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen across the advisory, with up to another inch expected to fall between 8:30 and 9:30 pm. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Inez, Warfield, Preece, Prince, Bradbury, Debord, Delong, Pevier, Davella, McClure, Andy, Lovely, Pleasant, Beauty, Calf Creek and Hode.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
